title: Did I miss something or isn\'t the assassination of a president worthy of a mention in the \Today in History\" column?"
text:
You're right, it should have been listed there. In fact, the
original copy - provided by The Associated Press - led with the JFK
entry. Unfortunately, that paragraph apparently was deleted by
non-newsroom employees for space considerations when the page was
assembled. Here's the text that was deleted:



On Nov. 22, 1963, President John F. Kennedy was assassinated while
riding in a motorcade in Dallas; Texas Gov. John B. Connally, in the
same car as Kennedy, was seriously wounded. Suspect Lee Harvey Oswald
was arrested.
